''Bacchante'' served for a while with the [[Mediterranean Fleet (United Kingdom)|Mediterranean Fleet]]. In 1906 she was transferred to the [[North America and West Indies Station|North America and West Indies Squadron]] and served there until she returned to home waters. At the outbreak of the [[First World War]], ''Baccante'' served as the flagship of the [[Live Bait Squadron]], blockading the English Channel from the North Sea to German traffic. ''Bacchante'' took part in the [[landing at Anzac Cove]] during the [[Battle of Gallipoli]] in 1915. When the [[infantry]] came under fire from [[Turkey|Turkish]] [[artillery]] at [[Gaba Tepe]], ''Bacchante'' approached close in to shore and fired directly on the gun emplacements in an attempt to silence them. ''Bacchante'' was sold in 1920. ==References== *{{Colledge}} *[http://www.clydesite.co.uk/clydebuilt/viewship.asp?id=5183 HMS ''Bacchante'' (Clydebuilt Ships Database)] ==Sources== * {{Cite web | title = Old Weather - HMS ''Bacchante'' | accessdate = 2012-01-22 | url = http://www.naval-history.net/OWShips-WW1-05Bacchante.htm }} Transcription of ship's logbooks and weather information {{Cressy class cruiser}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bacchante (1901)}} [[Category:Cressy-class cruisers]] [[Category:Clyde-built ships]] [[Category:World War I cruisers of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:1901 ships]]
